7. We have classified materials as diamagnetic, paramagnetic, and ferromagnetic. However, there exist additional types of magnetic material such as ferrimagnetic, anti-ferromagnetic, spin glass, etc. with properties which are exotic and mysterious.
summary: The BCS theory was proposed in 1957 and was eventually recognised by a Nobel Prize in physics in 1970. Diamagnetism is universal but weak, present in all materials. Magnetic materials are divided into diamagnetic, paramagnetic, and ferromagnetic categories, but there exist additional exotic magnetic material types such as ferrimagnetic, anti-ferromagnetic, and spin glass.
